Uses of Package
com.vectorprint.report.itext.style.stylers

  • Packages that use com.vectorprint.report.itext.style.stylers 
    Package Description
    com.vectorprint.report.itext
    primary classes for building iText reports; typically one will first study the possibilities of styling and annotating existing dataclasses, extend DataCollectorImpl and use ReportRunner to run the report.
    com.vectorprint.report.itext.debug
    classes to support debugging your reports by adding visual feedback to the report in a layer and information on the setup and the styling used
    com.vectorprint.report.itext.style
    interfaces and classes to support configurable styling of iText reporting elements in a css like manner.
    com.vectorprint.report.itext.style.stylers
    Parametrizable classes responsible for styling.
  • Classes in com.vectorprint.report.itext.style.stylers used by com.vectorprint.report.itext 
    Class and Description
    Advanced
    An advanced styler is a styler that is meant to draw directly on the canvas as opposed to regular stylers that only configure elements later to be added to the document.
    SimpleColumns
    Printing content (text, tables, lists and images) in rectangular columns of equal width with spacing between them.
  • Classes in com.vectorprint.report.itext.style.stylers used by com.vectorprint.report.itext.debug 
    Class and Description
    AbstractStyler
    Baseclass for stylers providing support for some general functionality such as parameters, conditions, help and Element class support.
    Advanced
    An advanced styler is a styler that is meant to draw directly on the canvas as opposed to regular stylers that only configure elements later to be added to the document.
    AdvancedImpl
    an advanced styler for directly drawing on a canvas, can be used from setup in two ways: draw (conditionally) on each page, draw after a certain Chunk is drawn.
  • Classes in com.vectorprint.report.itext.style.stylers used by com.vectorprint.report.itext.style 
    Class and Description
    Advanced
    An advanced styler is a styler that is meant to draw directly on the canvas as opposed to regular stylers that only configure elements later to be added to the document.
  • Classes in com.vectorprint.report.itext.style.stylers used by com.vectorprint.report.itext.style.stylers 
    Class and Description
    AbstractFieldStyler
    Base class for drawing form fields on the canvas of a cell.
    AbstractPositioning
    This styler is meant to draw near an Chunk using the generic tag mechanism of Chunk.
    AbstractStyler
    Baseclass for stylers providing support for some general functionality such as parameters, conditions, help and Element class support.
    Advanced
    An advanced styler is a styler that is meant to draw directly on the canvas as opposed to regular stylers that only configure elements later to be added to the document.
    Advanced.BLENDMODE 
    Advanced.DelayedData
    a holder for data added to the report by using stylers
    Advanced.EVENTMODE
    draw upon text added, table drawn, cell drawn or all three.
    Advanced.TRANSFORMMATRIX
    NOTE: transform matrix and rotate option in image don't play well together
    AdvancedImpl
    an advanced styler for directly drawing on a canvas, can be used from setup in two ways: draw (conditionally) on each page, draw after a certain Chunk is drawn.
    Barcode.BARCODE 
    DocumentSettings.DIGESTALGORITHM 
    DocumentSettings.ENCRYPTION 
    DocumentSettings.KEYSTORETYPE 
    DocumentSettings.PDFBOX 
    DocumentSettings.PERMISSION 
    FieldBorder.BORDERSTYLE 
    Font
    font settings for text (chunks and phrases)
    Font.ENCODING 
    Font.STYLE 
    Image
    Class for adding images (pdf (first page), tiff (first page) or other formats supported by the default awt toolkit) to a report.
    ImportTiff
    import pages from a tiff image near a certain element
    List.LISTTYPE 
    ListItem
    Settings for listItems, numbered, alpha, bullet,...
    Shape.SHAPE 
    SimpleColumns
    Printing content (text, tables, lists and images) in rectangular columns of equal width with spacing between them.
    SimpleColumns.MODE 
    Spacing
    printing space before / after a table, paragraph or image
